question_1.question: What is a new feature of TimeXtender SaaS that enhances automation capabilities within Azure?

options.option_a: Support for Snowflake as a Data Warehouse target storage
options.option_b: Run PowerShell scripts in Execution Packages
options.option_c: Goodbye License Keys and Client Secrets
options.option_d: Simplified Multiple-Environment management & transfer in the portal

question_1.explanation: TimeXtender SaaS now allows users to run PowerShell scripts in Execution Packages, which unlocks significant automation capabilities within Azure.

question_2.question: Which of the following features from TimeXtender v20.10 is NOT present in the new SaaS version?

options.option_c: User sign-in and granular user permission management

question_2.explanation: Business Units are one of the features from TimeXtender v20.10 that are no longer present in the new SaaS version.

question_3.question: Before using the Migration Tool to upgrade from TimeXtender v20.10, what must be done according to the provided checklist?

options.option_a: Create a new project in the latest version
options.option_b: Upgrade to the newest version of LTS
options.option_d: Generate new License Keys and Client Secrets

question_3.explanation: According to the checklist, you need to upgrade to the newest version of LTS (Long Time Support) before using the Migration Tool.

question_4.question: What is the purpose of the 'Validate' step when using the Migration Tool in TimeXtender?

options.option_a: To confirm user permissions for the migration
options.option_b: To ensure the same destination instance is not selected twice
options.option_c: To check the compatibility of the old data sources with the new version
options.option_d: To validate the project's semantic models

question_4.explanation: The 'Validate' step checks to ensure that the same destination instance is not selected twice and also validates that the project is mapped into a Data Warehouse instance.
